choices.D: By default, data never ages out of the process analytics database because it is not periodically purged.
choices.A: Workload dashboards report on completed instances.
choices.B: Performance dashboards report on in-flight instances.
choices.C: By default, there is a 30-minute delay for workload data to be reflected in standard dashboards.

discussion.content:
C. By default, there is a 30-minute delay for workload data to be reflected in standard dashboards.
D. By default, data never ages out of the process analytics database because it is not periodically purged.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about standard dashboards?

discussion.content: C. The JCA binding file defines default adapter property values for each applicable operation defined in the WSDL.

questions.question_text: Which statement is true about the relationship between the WSDL and the JCA binding file when working with an Oracle Adapter at design time?

choices.D: There is no direct relationship between the WSDL and the JCA binding file at design time.
choices.A: The WSDL references the appropriate JCA binding file for each applicable operation in the WSDL "binding" element.
choices.C: The JCA binding file defines default adapter property values for each applicable operation defined in the WSDL.
choices.B: All operations defined in the WSDL must be mapped to activation specifications in the JCA binding file.

discussion.content:
B. Process owners can act on tasks belonging to their process, but are assigned to other users.
D. Administrators typically get involved to handle task escalations

http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E23943_01/user.1111/e15175/bpmug_ws_mng_workloads.htm#BPMUG207

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about stakeholders working with Business Process Workspace?

choices.C: Process participants can delegate work to another user.
choices.B: Process owners can act on tasks belonging to their process, but are assigned to other users.
choices.D: Administrators typically get involved to handle task escalations.
choices.A: Process owners manage rules for users and groups.
EPN is the internal structure of an OEP application and is displayed as a top-down hierarchy in a graphical editor.
choices.E: Every event that arrives at the OEP server creates a new instance of an EPN.
choices.D: EPN is a part of the Event Delivery Network (EDN) facility that supports event-driven architecture for SOA Suite.
choices.B: EPN defines an OEP application and is built using the EPN Editor in JDeveloper.
choices.C: EPN is an interconnection of adapters, channels, event beans, and CQL processors that make up an OEP application.

discussion.content:
B. EPN defines an OEP application and is built using the EPN Editor in JDeveloper.
C. "EPN is an interconnection of adapters, channels, event beans, and CQL processors that make up an OEP application."

questions.question_text:
EPN is the internal structure of an OEP application and is displayed as a top-down hierarchy in a graphical editor. Which two statements are correct about the
Event Processing Network (EPN) in Oracle Event Processing (OEP)?

choices.D: It requires the JMS consumer to explicitly commit transactions.
choices.A: It supports connections to JMS distributed queues.
choices.C: It supports zero message loss via distributed transactions.
choices.B: It uses default credentials when connecting to the remote JMS provider.

discussion.content:
A. It supports connections to JMS distributed queues.
B. It uses default credentials when connecting to the remote JMS provider.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about the defined Oracle JMS Adapter outbound connection?
